p: The prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is 370 million people in the world. The T2DM is most frequent in adulthood; however, in the last years, the prevalence of T2DM is increasing in adolescents and children [ 1, 2]. T2DM is a chronic metabolic disease characterized by long-term insulin resistance and a decrease of β-cell function and population. These factors impair insulin release and consequently cause hyperglycemia [ 3, 4]. However, genetic and environmental factors are responsible for 20% of β-cell failure in the diabetic population [ 2].
